results.title: Spiritual voices from the diaries of war: a narration in five episodes
results.creator_credit: Studio Bereg, Aleksandr Burov, Vladimir Fotijev, V.V.S. Roskomkino, Lenfilm, Eskomfilm and Alexander Sokurov
results.brief_description:
Born in 1951 in the Soviet Union, Sokurov has increasingly gained a reputation as the most important of contemporary Russian film artists. An heir to the transcendent cinema of Andrei Tarkovsky, Sokurov’s body of work forms a rich examination of Russian history and culture, imbued with a spiritual and ethical commitment to the European humanist literary tradition.

‘Spiritual Voices’ was shot with video equipment over an 18-month period in which Sokurov accompanied a young army platoon during harsh and dangerous patrols along the battle lines of the USSR’s war with Afghanistan. Absorbing the gestures and emotions of the homesick young soldiers, Sokurov developed a deep understanding of squadron life. Accordingly, ‘Spiritual Voices’ is free of the usual cinematic bombast concerning war: there is no tightly structured dramatic conflict between good and evil, no diverting spectacles, no individual heroism leading the viewer through a fable of personal and national triumph.

The five parts of ‘Spiritual Voices’ were originally intended to be shown as a serial spanning several sessions for television or cinema. But Sokurov has permitted ACMI to install the work with all five channels playing simultaneously. Viewed in this extraordinarily rich configuration, ‘Spiritual Voices’ vividly captures the mysteriously patterned, non-linear experience of war.

As viewers scan the five screens trying to take in all the information that is assailing them, they piece together an appropriately discontinuous impression of war. Even so, as they sit amidst the platoon’s activities, gestures, and flickering glances, it is clarity rather than frustration or confusion that quickly arises. The work’s complexity sustains and exalts, because the aesthetics of Sokurov’s framing, sound design and editing all imbue the installation with an astounding cohesion. Even though the themes are futility, cruelty and incomprehension, the artwork itself is an inspiring insight into the mess that is war.

results.title: Speed
results.creator_credit: Jan De Bont, Mark Gordon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Spectacle Director Showcase: Paul Goldman
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Acclaimed Australian filmmaker Paul Goldman has directed over 200 music videos including work for Elvis Costello, INXS, Kylie Minogue, Crowded House and Silverchair. Paul also directed seminal Australian films like ‘Australian Rules’ and ‘Suburban Mayhem’. In this inverview, Paul talks candidly about his early music videos for Nick Cave’s ‘The Birthday Party’ and ‘The Reels’.

Created as part of “Spectacle : The Music Video Exhibition” 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014. ACMI Digital Programs worked with Exhibitions to interview five Australian directors featured in the exhibition about the art and techniques of music video production.

results.title: Splendour in the grass
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Deanie (Natalie Wood) is a beautiful teenager eager to do what is right in her staunchly moral hometown, in the 1920’s but the emotions she shares with her boyfriend, Bud (Warren Beatty) are too strong to ignore. Eventually the conflict between what society expects and what their desires demand pushes Bud to physical collapse and Deanie to madness. The young stars bring freshness and intensity to this story of parental domination, moral codes and young love, directed with insight and power by Elia Kazan.

results.title: Spitfire over Australia
results.brief_description: During World War II, more than 650 Spitfire aircraft were delivered to the RAAF. This is the story of Colin Pay, who rebuilt one of those magnificent machines, a Vickers Supermarine Spitfire HF Mk VIII built in 1944, from the corroded hulk he acquired in 1982. It is now a superbly restored flying machine. Including some of the best air to air colour footage ever shot of a Spitfire in Australia, and archival footage of Spitfires in Darwin in 1943 and interviews with the pilots who originally flew them, this is the ideal video for avaition enthusiasts!

results.title: Spectacle Director Showcase: Oh Yeah Wow
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Shelley Matulick, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
‘Oh Yeah Wow’ are a Melbourne based creative collective that make music videos, short films and TV programs. In this interview directors Darcy Prendergast, Seamus Spilsbury and Josh Thomas discuss music videos.

Created as part of “Spectacle : The Music Video Exhibition” 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014. ACMI Digital Programs worked with Exhibitions to interview five Australian directors featured in the exhibition about the art and techniques of music video production.
